symptoms.name: Blurred vision
symptoms.pattern: Can range from mild to severe, depending on the extent of inflammation

symptoms.name: Redness and pain in the eye
symptoms.pattern: May be present, especially in acute cases

symptoms.name: Decreased visual acuity
symptoms.pattern: Can progress to light perception in severe cases

symptoms.name: Vitritis
symptoms.pattern: Inflammation of the vitreous humor, may be present

symptoms.name: Optic disc edema
symptoms.pattern: May be present, particularly in cases with papilledema

physical_findings: Foci of chorioretinitis confined to the ocular fundus
Cushingoid appearance (in one case due to steroid treatment)
Hyperemic disc with blurred margins and obliterated cup-to-disk ratio due to disc edema (in one case)
Papilledema with exudates around the macula (in one case)

lab_values.Complete blood count: May show abnormalities like elevated ESR and CRP
lab_values.Tuberculin skin test (TST): Positive with induration > 10mm (often >15mm in low-risk populations, >5mm may indicate active infection)
lab_values.Chest X-ray/CT scan: May be normal even in cases of ocular TB

risk_factors: Residence in a region endemic to TB

imaging_findings.Fundoscopy: May show chorioretinal lesions, choroidal tubercles, papilledema, exudates
imaging_findings.Optical coherence tomography (OCT): May show choroidal tubercles and granulomatous lesions

required: Positive results from tests for tuberculosis (e.g., TST, QFT-G, PCR of intraocular fluid)
supportive: Abnormal lab values (e.g., elevated ESR, CRP)
Imaging findings consistent with tuberculous chorioretinitis
